channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged drug kingpin is arrested in Mexico
item.description: Ryan Wedding was among the FBI's top fugitives and faces charges related to drug trafficking and the killing of a federal witness. He reportedly turne...

item.title: Trump expands policy banning aid to groups abroad that discuss or provide abortions
item.description: In addition to adding to the list of groups that will lose funding for providing or discussing abortion, the policy now also calls for ending aid to g...

item.title: Gladys West, mathematician whose work paved the way for GPS, dies at 95
item.description: A self-described "little farm girl" in the Jim Crow Era, Gladys West's complex and pioneering work for the U.S. Navy helped to improve billions of liv...

item.title: At Davos, U.S. allies question a fraying world order
item.description: It was a volatile week for trans-Atlantic relations, marked by President Trump statements that unsettled global markets and strained ties with U.S. al...

item.title: 'Get warm, get safe and stay there,' officials warn as massive storm bears down on U.S.
item.description: Forecasters say the storm will dump heavy snow, sleet and freezing rain from the Southern Rockies into New England through Monday.

item.title: Frank Gardner: Not only Americans risked life and limb to serve in Afghanistan
item.description: Brits, Canadians and Danes were among those who saw the toughest fighting, writes the BBC's security correspondent.

item.title: The Uplift: A surprise from Shaq
item.description: Shaquille O'Neal steps in to a young 7-foot-3 police recruit from Texas. Plus, a behind-the-scenes look at the reality competition show "The Traitors,...

item.title: Alleged drug kingpin and ex-Olympian Ryan Wedding arrested after years on the run
item.description: Wedding, who had been on the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list, is accused of running a transnational drug trafficking operation.

item.title: More than half the US threatened with ice, snow and cold in massive winter storm
Harry says sacrifices by Nato troops in Afghanistan deserve 'respect'
item.description: The US president's comments have been condemned by international allies, including UK veterans and politicians.

item.title: Trump officials contradict witness claims about ICE raid where 5-year-old boy was detained

item.title: Philadelphia sues over removal of slavery exhibit at Independence National Historical Park
Danish PM in Greenland for 'show of support' after Trump threats
item.description: Mette Frederiksen visits the territory after weeks of tension over the US president's warnings that he could take control of it.

item.title: High stakes but low expectations for Ukraine talks with Russia and US
item.description: Donald Trump is pushing hard for a peace deal - but major issues between Russia and Ukraine are still unresolved, writes Sarah Rainsford.

item.title: Slavery displays removed from Philadelphia historical site after Trump directive
item.description: A series of informational signs about slavery was removed Thursday from the President's House historical site in Philadelphia.

item.title: Bank of America may introduce credit card with 10% APR
item.description: Facing pressure from President Trump, credit card issuers are exploring ways to ease borrowing costs.
